NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. give a short general description of (sth). 概括；概述
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. We outlined our main objections to the proposal.
e.g. We are only at the start of our job-hunting.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. a thing that is suggested or implied; a thing that is not openly stated 含意；暗示
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He smiled, with the implication that he didn't believe me.

NewWords.WordPhrase: ad. by that means or action 因此，由此，从而
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He became a citizen, thereby gaining the right to vote.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. that can be done; possible 可行的；可能的；有理的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. It is not feasible to follow your proposals.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. having or showing a sensible and practical idea of what can be done, achieved, etc. 现实的，实际的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She gave us a realistic appraisal of our chances.
e.g. The report was produced by the Government in cooperation with the chemical industry.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. any of the parts of which sth. is made 元件，组件；部件，零件
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Blade and handle are the component parts of a knife.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. of different kinds; varied 多种多样的；形形色色的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Her interests are very diverse.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. lasting or expected to last for a long time or for ever 永久的；持久的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She is looking for permanent employment.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. put (sth.) into effect; carry (sth.) out 贯彻；执行；实施
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The committee's decision will be implemented immediately.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. a thing, amount, word, etc. that is equal in value, importance, etc. 相等物；等价物
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Is there a French word that is the exact equivalent of the English word "home"?

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. suitable, acceptable or correct in the circumstances 适当的，恰当的，相称的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. His casual clothes were not appropriate for such a formal occasion.

NewWords.WordPhrase: by using (sth.); with the help of (sth.) 用，依靠
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. We crossed the stream by means of a log.
e.g. He nearly died of exposure on the cold mountain.

NewWords.WordPhrase: v. become or make (sb./sth.) mature （使）成熟，（使）长成
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The child's judgment matures as she grows older.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. the bringing of (sth.) into use or operation for the first time 采用；引进
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The introduction of new advanced techniques in the factory is under discussion today.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. interpret or understand (sth.) in a certain way 把…看作，认为
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. I perceived his comment as a challenge.
